DOC.brief_summary: Compare percent change loss body weight OPTIFAST program food-based energy-deficit program
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Optifast Program Compared With Reduced-energy Food Based Diet Plan Body Weight
DOC.criteria: Adult male females 18 70 year Obese ( BMI > 30 kg/m2 55 kg/m2 ) Nonsmokers smoke cessation > 6 month < 14 alcoholic beverage per week Willing able give inform consent Active participation weight loss program within previous 3 month Weight change > 5 % body weight within previous 3 month Participated Optifast program within prior 5 year Prior bariatric surgery liposuction Use medication prescribe weight loss past 3 month Current major disease GI disease poorly control ( Crohn 's , ulcerative colitis ) Type 1 DM Current ESRD Current COPD Any major active hepatic disease require inpatient outpatient treatment History acute pancreatitis past year Active cancer treatment past 2 year nonmalignant skin cancer Uncontrolled hypertension ( Blood pressure 160/100 great ) Hemoglobin A1c > 10 % Recent CV event past 6 month Pregnancy , childbirth , nursing within prior 6 month Eating Attitudes Test ( EAT26 ) > 30 Current major depressive disorder Center Epidemiological Studies Depression ScaleRevised ( CESDR ) score > 16 Schizophrenia , history bipolar disorder Recent hospitalization psychiatric illness past 6 month Dependence alcohol sedativehypnotic drug Intolerance allergy Optifast product Unable read/speak English Orthopedic limitation prevent participation regular physical activity Untreated thyroid disease , abnormal TSH , non stable dose hormone replacement hyperthyroidism Major surgery define surgical procedure might require prolonged convalescence limit participation program way Inability complete 7day runin satisfactorily
